comments.body: What do you guys think? Should it be put in ? Tell me why or why not
I don't like this idea as normal mining would be irrelevant and mining is a huge part of Minecraft.
I mean yes it is a big part of minecraft I think that the villagers the snow biome would be a mining group on top of the new tables they put out I think it would be cool to see I'm action
What if they also read while gathering at the bell in the afternoon? And at this time, all the villagers would listen to the story.

Yeah but they would similarly be neutral until you attack the Illagers, vindicators, or evokers. They could be black with red as secondary color. They couldn't be "built" like regular golems, but they could be healed like zombie villagers and in their gratitude they would prioritize killing mobs that attacked you. They could be named corrupted golems or illager golems.
This is listed in the "never being added" section

No way! The nether update is awesome! And plus, enchanted items NEED to be expensive. If you pay 1 emerald for an enchanted item, then a whole gigantic goal (making an enchanting table & getting the lapis for it) would be demolished! Enchanted items would practically lose their worth completely! I would certainly pay 20 emeralds for an enchanted diamond sword if I didn‚Äôt have an enchanting table, a diamond sword, or the lapis to use one! This is outrageous, and I certainly hope Mojang doesn‚Äôt put this into consideration.
Why would you want to do that? it would make lapis and enchanting tables useless!

im not criticizing the nether update, just this one feature. I agree the nether update is one of the best updates in minecraft. As for the argument that it would make enchanting tables useless, the enchantment table lets you choose what enchantment you want while the trades give you a forced enchantment usually at level 1. And the likelyhood that you would have 20 emeralds before you have a diamond sword is extremely unlikely. Enchanted Items' worth wasnt lost before, and it wont be again.

For those who dont want a 12-Emerald Unbreaking I Iron Sword, please consider upvoting this post

Absolutely not! The new villager trades are wonderful for many reasons, primarily (in my opinion) because they increased the trade cap - I can trade carrots with farmers, for example, like 10 times in one go instead of 4. Carrots are so easy to farm because you throw looting on a hoe from an anvil and you get 64+ carrots from an 8-10 plot of farm. Same with potatoes. I am able to level up a villager to master in one sitting and that was never possible before. Emeralds are now significantly easier to obtain than they were before and it‚Äôs only natural that the prices be amped. I always thought it was strange that the diamond things were as cheap as they were to be honest. There‚Äôs a reason so few people have upvoted this post. It‚Äôs a very bad suggestion that I hope they ignore completely. You say the unlikelihood of having 20 emeralds is unlikely, but are you just really bad at trading or something? I got 33 emeralds from ONE farmer in one trading session just last night. And I have 2 farmers. You can sell rotten flesh to clerics, an item you will have at any point in the game. I say all that to say this: you‚Äôre wrong. You either don‚Äôt research properly, haven‚Äôt traded with villagers enough to know better, or just aren‚Äôt willing to put in the work to get the emeralds.

There‚Äôs a reason so few people have upvoted this post. You either don‚Äôt research properly, haven‚Äôt traded with villagers enough to know better, or just aren‚Äôt willing to put in the work to get the emeralds.

395683597431 A good chunk of what you said violates the posting guidelines, you should probably read those before commenting.

ok where do they get the nether wart

Yes! It would be a nice way to make automatic netherwart farms too.

The cleric should have the same rules applied to it though as the farmer has. Only tend to netherwart that is within a 15 block diamond shaped radius of its jobsite.

Also the village temple structures could have a random chance at generating with a small netherwart patch outside the structure. Perhaps just a planter box with a couple blocks of soulsand with netherwart on top.
Excess formatting removed.
Maybe the "Soul Skeletons" could fight with sword and Bo and use some camouflage in Soul Sand Valley because, the Soul Sand Valley is Out of Soul Sand and Camouflage would bei good to it I think.
good idea, but nausea for 8 seconds sounds a little rough don't you think?

I mean, making the skeletons having these types of affects makes the nether more dangerous and more of a threat, at the end of day the nether should be challenging, sure in fact theirs way to overcome like placing blocking while sprinting/jumping in the Soul sand valley, however with a mob like this which causes harming and nausea would make the player off guard. Another comment would be it would be better if the skeletons just use bows instead of swords, since we already have a mob like that in the nether (Wither Skeletons)
We Already Have One Don‚Äôt We? The Wither Skeleton.
They should run from the same things piglins run from but they should attack normal piglins

Whether it's by wearing netherite or doing something completely different, I'd like for there to be a way to let Piglins survive in the Overworld without commands.

Yeah, I mean‚Äîwho doesn‚Äôt want a way to have Piglins in the Overworld where they don‚Äôt transform? There should be at least SOME way to keep them from transforming, whether by armor or a splash potion that permanently makes them immune to transforming. Not with commands; I play survival (Bedrock).
As a martial artist.. YES! But i feel like this better suits a mod
Do villagers need to drink potions?
This would be great for helping out in raids! Also it would be really good for map making

I'm glad you are excited about this idea! Yes, intangible blocks would be used for keeping out intangible creatures, which could potentially include vexes. The Ascendance post has links to most of the current intangible post ideas in the first two comments, including the blocks mentioned. Shade crystal is the only exception I have come up with, and it should be noted that I need to rework it for balancing purposes. I hope you enjoy these additional ideas! Please note that the posts are separate for a reason as well. Vote for whatever ones you like best without feeling restricted or obligated by any you may not. I would also love to hear additional ideas and constructive criticism!
omg this would be soooooooooo useful. Its so annoying trying to find a villagers current bed /job if I want them to have one of my choosing
This is great because I tried making a giant village with many different types of villagers it took so long to get 2 there.

This would make an excellent way to recall pets that have gotten lost sitting somewhere while exploring.

Minecraft desperately needs a way to recall pets in survival. This would be a new way to interact with pets which definitely could use an update, especially the üê∂.

There could be a way to train them to do 2 or 3 actions that make sense respectively.

But the most important thing is recalling lost sitting pets.... its a problem üòï üò™

Yes! This would be an awesome feature to add!!! It would be great if you could immediately summon your trusty steed to your side when you're ready to ride. The whistle could work on your pet/tamed animal no matter how far they wander, and this would prevent players from having to build pens for their animals. If one wanders away, just whistle for them!

Not a bad idea!
I actually liked it
This would be a fun way to make snow golems similar to iron golems! Would it be possible to heal them with snowballs as well?
Maybe villagers and iron golems could be hostile to you when doing this too.
Nice idea
Once you enter a dimension the Wandering Trader should be able to appear there and offer items from that dimension

I mean they have their own control of the crops just like the player so that's why this exists.

Yeah they should DEFINITELY only replant crops because I've been playing a world where we brought villagers to a custom village and the farmers took away all the crops and planted nothing but potatoes. So I am definitely voting for this.
I was just about to post this, They spawn everywhere! They should spawn every 5-10 days. not every day.
How long have you've been in your world? That might be the issue.
It must be a bug then.
I was about to Submit that- They spawn ALL over my base.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
:) Just because they're unemployed doesn't mean they can't be good citizens!

The idea behind my game play is go out and explore to find materials, then come back to base to build with those materials. The iron farms have been so badly nerfed on console and bedrock that in order to suit up and explore more dangerous areas we are constantly mining. I am out of iron in my game because we built a super smelter system in order to smelt our items automatically so we could build a huge castle. The castle looks great. But I'm wearing leather and back to stone again. If I want my farm to produce I have to afk. I don't like to play that way.

theres no need to add another block for villager paths, villages already have pathways made from the "grass path" block. it would make more sense to have villagers "prefer" to step on grass paths instead of elsewhere.

It would be pretty sensible if it was easier to transport villagers. Maybe abandoned villages spawn in jungles and swamps is a good hint to making players more easily get such villager types. And, make the enchanted books and equipment actually of a good level.

Yeah this villager trade rebalance has a plethora of issues, its not just about transporting the villagers either, its building a breeder in each biome, waiting for the correct villager with the garb of that biome to grow up, transporting multiple shipments of resources and emeralds to this librarian, and you have to stay in simulation distance while this baby grows up, and I don't even want to tell you what I do with the plains villager babies when I'm trying to grow jungle villagers. Also another big issue is now this biome specific trade option thing forces me to keep looking up which enchantments correspond to which biome, and what the level cap is for that enchantment for the librarian, is it a master level trade? I shouldn't need to do a research project every time I want to just play the game, either have in game data, or don't have such specific biome locking. All in all, this villager rebalance feels so forced and not fun, it just adds more tedium and just another thing where I need to open up external resources to make anything out, Mojang stop just stretching out the midgame. Also I agree, enchantment table needs to be improved, they could've applied these biome specific enchantments to the enchantment table, or at least have a weighted system where certain enchantments become more likely in a specific biome but not hard locked.
